item.source: What is the problem with the code?

item.title: What is the problem with the code?
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

you forgot breaks;
So if you had all 3 of those items in your inventory and you drank the first potion, it would drink all 3.
Not too convenient. Conventions are bad.

    public void setIt(int items){
         if(playerHasItem(items)){
               switch(items){
                       case 133:
                            sendMessage("You drink the defence potion");
                            break;
                       case 739:
                            sendMessage("I wouldn't want to drink this!");
                            break;
                       case 1038:
                            deleteItem(1038, getItemSlot(1038), 1);
                            break;
                       default:
                            sendMessage("Nothing interesting happens.");
                            break;
                   }
             }
       }

Read full topic

item.title: What is the problem with the code?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

What’s up with the extra parameter if it isn’t even used in the method?

public void setIt(int items){ if(playerHasItem(items)){ switch(items){ case 133: sendMessage("You drink the defence potion"); break; case 739: sendMessage("I wouldn't want to drink this!"); break; case 1038: deleteItem(1038, getItemSlot(1038), 1); break; } } }

Show us how you’re trying to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the problem with the code?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:1, topic:490323”]hey, i made a new method and it have no influence on the server look :

	public void setIt(int items, int ID){
	if(playerHasItem(items)){
	switch(items){
	case 133:
	sendMessage("You drink the defence potion");
	
	
	case 739:
	sendMessage("I wouldn't want to drink this!");
	
	
	case 1038:
	deleteItem(1038, getItemSlot(1038), 1);
	
				}
			}
		}

i want it to work. its just say : nothing intersting is happen.
Thank you for help.[/quote]

I wouldn’t waste time doing this, there is class that handles exactly what you’re trying to do.
